Horizontally-projected area of mooring elements

Source: R/area.R
area.Rd

The areas are not computed by this function, but rather looked up for each element. To learn how areas are computed during setup, see the help page for anchor(), chain(), connector(), float(), instrument(), misc(), or release().

area(m)

Arguments

m

either a mooring object, created by mooring(), or a mooring-element object, created with

Value

area returns a numeric value of the area viewed from a horizontal, in m^2.

Details

For a summary of characteristics of the predefined models, see the vignette named "Default Values for Mooring Elements".

References

Dewey, Richard K. "Mooring Design & Dynamics-a Matlab® Package for Designing and Analyzing Oceanographic Moorings." Marine Models, vol. 1, no. 1 (December 1, 1999): 103–57. https://doi.org/10.1016/S1369-9350(00)00002-X

Dewey, Richard. "Mooring Design and Dynamics: A Matlab Package for Designing and Testing Oceanographic Moorings And Towed Bodies." Accessed May 15, 2021. http://canuck.seos.uvic.ca/rkd/mooring/mdd/mdd.php http://canuck.seos.uvic.ca/rkd/mooring/moordyn.php

Author

Dan Kelley

Examples

library(mooring)
area(float())
#> [1] 0.7853982
